item.title: Elisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "No matter who you are, no matter where you live, and no matter how many people are chasing you, what you don't read is often as important as what you do read." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "People aren't either wicked or noble. They're like chef's salads, with good things and bad things chopped and mixed together in a vinaigrette of confusion and conflict." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "But there are times in this harum-scarum world when figuring out the right thing to do is quite simple, but doing the right thing is simply impossible...." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is a curious thing, the death of a loved one. We all know that our time in this world is limited, and that eventually all of us will end up underneath some sheet, never to wake up. And yet it is always a surprise when it happens to someone we know. It is like walking up the stairs to your bedroom in the dark, and thinking there is one more stair than there is. Your foot falls down, through the air, and there is a sickly moment of dark surprise as you try and readjust the way you thought of things." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Taking one’s chances is like taking a bath, because sometimes you end up feeling comfortable and warm, and sometimes there is something terrible lurking around that you cannot see until it is too late and you can do nothing else but scream and cling to a plastic duck." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description:
"To have a child is the greatest honor and responsibility that can be bestowed upon any living being.
- Arya" -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "The true secret in being a hero lies in knowing the order of things. The swineherd cannot already be wed to the princess when he embarks on his adventures, nor can the boy knock on the witch's door when she is already away on vacation. The wicked uncle cannot be found out and foiled before he does something wicked. Things must happen when it is time for them to happen. Quests may not simply be abandoned; prophecies may not be left to rot like unpicked fruit; unicorns may go unrescued for a very long time, but not forever. The happy ending cannot come in the middle of the story." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "He really would have done all that for her, you see, and done it believing he'd burn in hell forever for doing it. He hadn't done it, and wouldn't had made her his anyway, but you see why he'd have figured it did. Or maybe I saw it anyway, at the time. He was a maniac and a monster, but people don't love like that anymore. Or maybe it's only the maniacs and monsters who do. I don't know. " -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "I love whom I love," Prince Lir repeated firmly. "You have no power over anything that matters." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Only to a magician is the world forever fluid, infinitely mutable and eternally new. Only he knows the secret of change, only he knows truly that all things are crouched in eagerness to become something else, and it is from this universal tension that he draws his power." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "The most professional curse ever snarled or croaked or thundered can have no effect on a pure heart." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Whatever can die is beautiful — more beautiful than a unicorn, who lives forever, and who is the most beautiful creature in the world. Do you understand me?" -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "The real things haven't changed. It is still best to be honest and truthful; to make the most of what we have; to be happy with simple pleasures; and have courage when things go wrong." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "There's no great loss without some small gain." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "It is a good idea sometimes to think of the importance and dignity of our every-day duties. It keeps them from being so tiresome; besides, others are apt take us at our own valuation. " -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I know. In fact, I am never wrong." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught." -- Oscar Wilde
